oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: People at Ashwood Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front view of Ashwood Hall showing six people standing in front and one on horseback. The home has full-length windows, Corinthian columns, a triangular pediment, and iron railing.

Ashwood Hall, known as the Marble Mansion, was built for Bishop Leonidas Polk in the 1830's. The house was later sold to Andrew Jackson Polk, who had the home expanded. The home was destroyed by a fire in 1874.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dwellings--Tennessee; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee
Houses; Columns; Corinthian order; Mansions; Architectural decorations & ornaments
